neighbors.name: NP Highridge Park LLC
neighbors.claims: NP Highridge Park LLC is a subsidiary of NorthPoint Development, a Kansas City, MO-based industrial real estate firm ([Shenandoah Sentinel](https://shensentinel.com/news/ppl-open-house-outlines-pole-line-upgrades-new-switchyard-at-highridge-industrial-park/)). The entity owns property in the Highridge Industrial Park where PPL Electric Utilities is constructing a new switchyard and high-voltage transmission upgrades intended to serve a 'new customer' and support load growth ([Shenandoah Sentinel](https://shensentinel.com/news/ppl-open-house-outlines-pole-line-upgrades-new-switchyard-at-highridge-industrial-park/)). In March (year context 2025/2026), the company purchased land in the park from the Schuylkill Economic Development Corp (SEDCO) for $6 million ([Shenandoah Sentinel](https://shensentinel.com/news/ppl-open-house-outlines-pole-line-upgrades-new-switchyard-at-highridge-industrial-park/)). NorthPoint has successfully petitioned the Schuylkill County Commissioners for Local Economic Revitalization Tax Assistance (LERTA) designations to facilitate industrial development at Highridge Business Park, securing tax exemptions for new construction ([Times News](https://www.tnonline.com/20210416/schuylkill-oks-tax-designation-for-highridge-business-park-sites/)). State Senator David Argall has held hearings regarding data center development in the region, involving discussion of NorthPoint's projects, indicating active political engagement on land use issues ([Delaware Currents](https://delawarecurrents.org/2025/09/08/pennsylvania-data-centers/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major industrial developer with direct access to county commissioners and state senators; successfully secured LERTA tax abatements; owns property hosting critical PPL grid infrastructure (switchyard) serving regional load growth.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate regarding the PPL switchyard construction and transmission upgrades occurring on their parcel. As a pro-development entity with active industrial projects, they are likely receptive to discussions about grid infrastructure that supports their tenants (potentially data centers). Acknowledge their LERTA status and recent $6M investment in the park.

neighbors.profile_summary: Subsidiary of NorthPoint Development; recently purchased Highridge Park land for $6M; site of new PPL switchyard; recipient of LERTA tax credits.
